alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Northern Livingston; St. Helena; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 2:26PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern West Feliciana, St. Helena, northwestern Livingston, East Feliciana and northern East Baton Rouge Parishes, eastern Wilkinson and Amite Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 226 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gillsburg to Pride to near Centreville. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Jackson, Clinton, Liberty, Greensburg, Walker, Centreville, Slaughter, Gloster, Wilson, Norwood, Montpelier, Spillman, Watson, Darlington, Pride and Greenwell Spring. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 9 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is also occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Northern Livingston; St. Helena; West Feliciana
